intro: Eschweilera idatimon, commonly known as the white-leafed zygocactus, is a species native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically a vibrant green. The plant produces striking white or pink flowers during the wet season, which are clustered in panicles. Eschweilera idatimon thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its unique appearance and ornamental value make it a sought-after plant in tropical horticulture.
